options.content: Say hi: @jake@jarv.is on fediverse.jarv.is

panels.title: ðŸ¦£ Welcome to the public metrics for my single-user Mastodon server! ðŸ“ˆ

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
panels.title: CPU Busy %

panels.description: Non available RAM memory
panels.title: Memory Used %

panels.description: Used Swap
panels.title: Swap Used %

panels.description: Used Root FS
panels.title: Disk Used %

panels.description: Amount of bandwidth used by Linode servers and media storage out of the monthly quota.
panels.title: Linode Transfer Quota %

panels.description: Time since last server restart.
panels.title: System Uptime

panels.description: Basic CPU info

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!='idle', mode!='user', mode!='system',mode!='iowait', mode!='irq', mode!='softirq'}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: CPU

panels.description: Basic memory usage
panels.title: Memory

panels.description: Basic network info per interface
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description: The total amount of worker jobs that Sidekiq is performing.
panels.title: Sidekiq Current Jobs

panels.description: A historical graph of the average queue delay for each of the main queues in Sidekiq. If the queues do not have wait-time, they are depicted green. They will go through yellow, orange and become red once the queue is backing up and worker jobs have to wait before being scheduled.
panels.title: Sidekiq Queue Delay

panels.description: The running average latency of HTTP Queries that Mastodon is serving.
panels.title: Sidekiq Avg Latency

panels.description: Rate of sidekiq worker invocations by worker type, split out by success and failure.
panels.title: Sidekiq Workers

panels.description: Running latency of sidekiq worker invocations by worker type.
panels.title: Sidekiq Workers Latency

panels.description: A total number of worker jobs waiting in the queue, usually due to there not being enough worker threads or sidekiq jobs to handle them in time. This graph here shows the n-count of elements in the queue.
panels.title: Sidekiq Queue Depth

panels.description: The running average latency of HTTP Queries that Mastodon is serving.
panels.title: Puma Avg Latency

panels.description: Rate of response codes/sec of HTTP API calls served by the Mastodon web server.
panels.title: Puma Controller Return Codes

panels.description: The total amount of HTTP Queries that Mastodon is serving.
panels.title: Puma Queries

panels.description: Rate of queries/sec of API calls served by the Mastodon web server.
panels.title: Puma Operations

panels.description: Current latency of API calls served by the Mastodon web server.
panels.title: Puma Operations Latency

panels.description: Total size of all files in the media storage bucket.
panels.title: Linode Bucket Size

panels.description: Number of files in the media storage bucket.
panels.title: Linode Bucket Objects

panels.title: Cache Operations
